Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory667.jpg'}
{3: 'Windmill Square, above the steps where paints are literally flying.'}
{3: 'Ayla has yet to set up her canvas and perform her finishing move despite being surrounded by all three Schools.'}
{3: 'Instead, she has started a one-versus-all debate by providing criticisms.'}
{3: 'Ayla has said that art criticism is a dangerous matter, especially when both sides are "armed."'}
{3: 'It is easy to express personal feelings beyond the canvases.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Will that stop the war?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mark', 3: 'How\'s that possible? "Palette Clash" is not going to stop before we decide on an art leader.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab', 2: '1'}
{3: 'Splash!'}
{3: 'As expected, someone has pulled the trigger on their paint sprayer, and chaos ensues.'}
{2: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiStoryJianXue.prefab'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{3: 'Ayla dodges their attacks with her Beam Gunlance while seeking a suitable spot.'}
{3: 'Meanwhile, the facilities and infrastructure around Windmill Square suffer.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Fourteen energy reserves have stopped working, and the sewage system is completely blocked by dried paint...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'All infrastructure within the vicinity will break down in approximately two hours.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'This is the most fierce war zone, after all...', 3: '28'}
{3: 'All kinds of mechanoids are physically clashing with each other at this point.'}
{3: 'You have to count on Ayla to stop them, or you will have to resort to force.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mark', 3: 'Oh? Have we started painting?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'No matter who wins, the situation here is far from over. It will take a long time to repair the facilities here.'}
{3: 'The art leader...'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: 'How can I help you?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Has there always been three Schools in the war?', 3: '37'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: 'There were 38 Schools at the beginning of Palette Clash, but only 3 remain now after the rest were eliminated.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'So... we just need a School to win?', 3: '39'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: "That's right. An art leader like Cervantes will emerge after a School wins.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'And the art leader will emerge...', 3: '41'}
{2: 'Because you all recognize them, or because somebody will select one?', 3: '42'}
{3: 'Mark turns silent. He does not respond as quickly as he did.'}
{3: 'Slowly, he starts talking when the signal lights that represent his thinking process have stopped blinking.'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: 'You have been traveling with Mark for a while, Commandant. I know you are different from the other humans, so I will tell you, and you alone.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: 'Cervantes was always the art leader of Constellia.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: 'After he left, Constellia lost a leader that everyone could support, and folks started to disagree with each other.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: 'Palette Clash is actually an art competition to select a new art leader.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Isn't this too far for a competition?", 3: '49'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: "You still don't understand how important art is to this city, Commandant.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: "We'll close our workshops and throw away our batteries and parts before we abandon our pursuit of art.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: "The mechanoids who aren't participating in the war aren't tired of paintings, or sculptures, or graffiti. They are only tired of fighting.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Is all of this... really worth it?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mark', 3: "I'm not sure I understand you, Dulcinea.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Mark's tone changes drastically as if Dulcinea's question has touched a sore spot."}
{3: 'You cannot tell if Dulcinea has noticed that, but still, she keeps speaking.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "I can't stop you, but Palette Clash's damage to the city is tangible. It is possible for the war to get out of control.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Dulcinea', 3: 'Constellia is at the critical stage of entering coexistence with humanity.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mark', 3: 'Are those the reasons we should abandon art?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Dulcinea', 3: "I don't know. I don't really understand art...", 4: '1'}
{2: "Mark, I'm not trying to ask you to give up on art...", 3: '68'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mark', 3: "Ah... You still can't understand...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: 'Mark has told you this is something you will never be able to convince us.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mark', 3: "Humans don't understand. Constructs don't understand. Humanoid mechanoids like Dulcinea don't understand.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Mark spins around where he stands, expressing his unease.'}
{3: 'When the signal lights that represent his thinking process stop blinking, Mark sets up his canvas, seemingly intending to put all his thoughts into his art.'}
{3: 'As silence surrounds you, Ayla achieves victory once again in the distance.'}
